skill.name: notion-knowledge-capture
skill.description: Convert conversations and notes into structured Notion pages using the Notion MCP. Transforms chats into wiki entries, how-tos, decisions, FAQs, and documentation with proper linking and organization.
skill.summary: Turn conversations into structured Notion knowledge base pages
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill is safe for publication. Static analysis flagged 41 patterns, but all are false positives. The supposed C2 keywords and weak crypto references are metadata fields in JSON, not executable code. The external command detections are markdown documentation examples showing backticks in code blocks, not actual shell execution. The skill contains only instructional content for using the Notion MCP integration with no executable code, network operations, or file system access beyond standard usage.

content.user_title: Capture Conversations into Structured Notion Pages
content.value_statement: Turn scattered conversations and notes into organized, searchable knowledge. This skill helps you transform chat discussions, decisions, and ideas into properly structured Notion pages with linking, templates, and team collaboration features.
actual_capabilities: Convert conversations into structured Notion pages using predefined database schemas
Guide users through setting up and authenticating with Notion MCP integration
Create decision logs, how-to guides, FAQs, team wikis, and documentation pages
Link related pages and establish relationships between knowledge base entries
Update existing Notion pages with new information from ongoing conversations
Apply templates and best practices for different content types
limitations: Requires Notion MCP to be installed and configured before use
Does not create or modify Notion database schemas automatically
Relies on user to provide correct database IDs and property configurations
Cannot access or modify Notion workspaces without proper OAuth authentication

use_cases.title: Document Team Decisions
use_cases.description: Product managers can capture design decisions, technical choices, and strategic discussions from Slack or meetings into a decision log database. Each entry includes context, alternatives considered, rationale, and links to related projects.

use_cases.title: Build Knowledge Base from Support Conversations
use_cases.description: Support teams can transform common customer questions and solutions into searchable FAQ pages. Links questions to related documentation and tags by product area for easy discovery.
use_cases.target_user: Customer support teams and technical writers

use_cases.title: Create How-To Guides from Implementations
use_cases.description: Developers can convert post-implementation discussions into step-by-step how-to guides. Includes prerequisites, code snippets, edge cases, and links to related documentation for team onboarding.

prompt_templates.title: Basic FAQ Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert the last 5 messages in this conversation into a FAQ entry in my Notion FAQ database
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick conversion of a single question-answer pair into your FAQ system

prompt_templates.title: Decision Log Entry
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a decision log entry about choosing React over Vue, including the alternatives we discussed, our rationale, and link it to the Web Platform project
prompt_templates.scenario: Document an architectural or strategic decision with full context

prompt_templates.title: How-To Guide from Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Turn our conversation about setting up CI/CD into a how-to guide in the DevOps documentation database, including all the commands and troubleshooting steps we covered
prompt_templates.scenario: Create reusable documentation from a technical implementation discussion

prompt_templates.title: Update Existing Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the existing Authentication Setup page in Notion and update it with the new OAuth flow we just discussed, preserving the existing content but adding the new section
prompt_templates.scenario: Enhance existing knowledge base pages with new information without starting from scratch

output_examples.input: Create a FAQ entry about API rate limits from this conversation
output_examples.output: I will create a FAQ entry in your Notion FAQ database. First, I need to search for any existing pages about rate limits to ensure we are not duplicating content. Then I will create a new page with the question as the title, your explanation as the answer, and tag it with API and Troubleshooting categories. The entry will link to your API Documentation hub page.

output_examples.input: Document our decision to migrate from PostgreSQL to MongoDB
output_examples.output: I will create a decision log entry with the following structure: Title - Database Migration to MongoDB, Context - current PostgreSQL limitations with document storage, Alternatives Considered - PostgreSQL with JSONB vs MongoDB vs DynamoDB, Decision - MongoDB for flexible schema, Rationale - better document querying and team familiarity, Date - today, Owner - you, Status - Approved. I will link this to the Backend Architecture project page.

best_practices: Set up Notion MCP and authenticate before starting knowledge capture workflows
Use consistent database schemas and templates for each content type to maintain organization
Always link new pages to hub pages and related content to create a connected knowledge graph
anti_patterns: Do not create pages without searching for existing content first to avoid duplicates
Avoid capturing conversations verbatim without structuring and summarizing the key information
Do not skip setting properties like tags, owners, and dates as they are essential for findability

faq.question: Do I need to install anything before using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, you need to install the Notion MCP integration and authenticate with your Notion workspace. The skill provides step-by-step setup instructions when you first use it.

faq.question: Can this skill create new Notion databases?
faq.answer: No, this skill works with existing Notion databases. You need to have your database schemas set up in Notion before using this skill to create pages within them.

faq.question: What types of content can I capture with this skill?
faq.answer: You can create decision logs, how-to guides, FAQs, team wiki entries, documentation pages, and learning notes. Each type follows specific templates and structures.

faq.question: How does the skill know which Notion database to use?
faq.answer: The skill guides you to specify the database type and uses reference templates to match the correct schema. You may need to provide the database ID for the first capture.

faq.question: Can I update existing Notion pages with new information?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill can search for existing pages and update them with new content while preserving the original structure and information.

faq.question: Does this work with all Notion workspace types?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with personal, team, and enterprise Notion workspaces as long as you have proper authentication and permissions to create and edit pages.
